title: How to get a copy of a deed of a house - Quora

response.answer_text: From your county,s Register of Deeds if you need a certified copy. Many counties would make digital copies available online, too, if you just want to see what it says and have a copy on hand. But if you need to use it for an official legal purpose, you will probably be required to provide a certified hard copy.

You can contact the borough or township you live in and they can either give you a copy or sent you to the courthouse where it's registered. But, if you used a title company, which most people do, you should ask them first. They can create a new one for you. It would be the office where the settlement/closing took place.

In the U.S. all property records are public record, meaning the information is kept by a local government office (typically a clerk and recorder) and made available online or in person for a small fee or no fee. Contact the county, parish or town where the property is located and they will direct you to the office that maintains land records.
